summary: Adolescents' use of drugs, alcohol, and tobacco has declined nationally over the last decade, but remains an issue. We surveyed all 50 states; Washington, D.C.; and 8 territories about substance use prevention in public schools. 56 completed the survey. 45 reported requiring schools to teach about at least 2 of the 3 substances 6 don't have requirements to teach about specific substances 5 have no...
title: K-12 Education: Most States Require Public Schools to Teach Substance Use Prevention
